lru-type.name: LO2
lru-type.description: The purpose of this document is to define the Monitor and Control interface between the Second Local Oscillator (LO2) and the Computing Monitor and Control software. A Fine Tuning Synthesizer is an integral part of the LO2. There is a separate ICD for Back-End/FTS to ICD Interface between Back End/Fine Tuning Synthesizer and Computing/Control Software. In the LO2, the FTS is a slave device. As such, the FTS relative CAN addresses (RCA) must be offset by 0x18000 (Hex)

assembly-type.name: LO2
assembly-type.description: The purpose of this document is to define the Monitor and Control interface between the Second Local Oscillator (LO2) and the Computing Monitor and Control software. A Fine Tuning Synthesizer is an integral part of the LO2. There is a separate ICD for Back-End/FTS to ICD Interface between Back End/Fine Tuning Synthesizer and Computing/Control Software. In the LO2, the FTS is a slave device. As such, the FTS relative CAN addresses (RCA) must be offset by 0x18000 (Hex)

baci-property.description: Logical status of the switches and loop lock status in the LO2.The PLL Lock bit (bit 2) provides a realtime indication of whether or not the synthesizer is locked. Bit 3 is a latched version of the bit 2 PLL Lock bit. It will latch high when the second LO goes out of lock for any detectable amount of time, i.e., 5 microseconds or longer. It can be unlatched using the RESET_LOCK_STATUS command (assuming the second LO is again locked as indicated by bit 2). Bit 3 will always be high and bit 2 low when the FM coil voltage is not between +/-7.5V.

monitor-point.description: Logical status of the switches and loop lock status in the LO2.The PLL Lock bit (bit 2) provides a realtime indication of whether or not the synthesizer is locked. Bit 3 is a latched version of the bit 2 PLL Lock bit. It will latch high when the second LO goes out of lock for any detectable amount of time, i.e., 5 microseconds or longer. It can be unlatched using the RESET_LOCK_STATUS command (assuming the second LO is again locked as indicated by bit 2). Bit 3 will always be high and bit 2 low when the FM coil voltage is not between +/-7.5V.

baci-property.description: Read back of the SET_LO2_FREQUENCY command.

monitor-point.description: Read back of the SET_LO2_FREQUENCY command.

baci-property.description: Actual voltage level of the +5V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the FTS.

monitor-point.description: Actual voltage level of the +5V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the FTS.

baci-property.description: Actual voltage level of the +15V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the phase lock loop (PLL) PCB.

monitor-point.description: Actual voltage level of the +15V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the phase lock loop (PLL) PCB.

baci-property.description: Actual voltage level of the -15V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the PLL PCB and the DYTO (heater only).

monitor-point.description: Actual voltage level of the -15V supply voltage after regulation. This is the voltage supplied to the PLL PCB and the DYTO (heater only).

baci-property.description: Actual voltage level of the +15V supply voltage after regulation. This voltage is supplied to the +15V input to the DYTO and the signal amplifier.

monitor-point.description: Actual voltage level of the +15V supply voltage after regulation. This voltage is supplied to the +15V input to the DYTO and the signal amplifier.

baci-property.description: The RF Power of the DYTO is detected in the loop of the PLL. The detector provides a negative voltage

monitor-point.description: The RF Power of the DYTO is detected in the loop of the PLL. The detector provides a negative voltage

baci-property.description: The IF Power in the loop of the PLL is detected. The detector provides a positive voltage.

monitor-point.description: The IF Power in the loop of the PLL is detected. The detector provides a positive voltage.

baci-property.description: The FTS Power in the loop of the PLL is detected. The detector provides a positive voltage.

monitor-point.description: The FTS Power in the loop of the PLL is detected. The detector provides a positive voltage.

baci-property.description: The voltage across the FM coil of the DYTO is measured directly. The Second LO Synthesizer works best when the FM Voltage is nominally 0V. The FM Voltage is driven to zero by changing the coarse tune setting of the DYTO. The phase lock loop can only lock properly when the FM voltage is between +/-7.5V.

monitor-point.description: The voltage across the FM coil of the DYTO is measured directly. The Second LO Synthesizer works best when the FM Voltage is nominally 0V. The FM Voltage is driven to zero by changing the coarse tune setting of the DYTO. The phase lock loop can only lock properly when the FM voltage is between +/-7.5V.

baci-property.description: The bit difference between the commanded and actual DYTO course tune frequency. This difference is a measure of the absolute frequency error of the DYTO. The course frequency tuning of the DYTO is not directly controllable but is indirectly controllable via the SET_LO2_FREQUENCY command. Firmware sets the course tune frequency in such a way as to maintain the FM coil voltage of the GET_FM_COIL_VOLTAGE command to within +/-2.5V.

monitor-point.description: The bit difference between the commanded and actual DYTO course tune frequency. This difference is a measure of the absolute frequency error of the DYTO. The course frequency tuning of the DYTO is not directly controllable but is indirectly controllable via the SET_LO2_FREQUENCY command. Firmware sets the course tune frequency in such a way as to maintain the FM coil voltage of the GET_FM_COIL_VOLTAGE command to within +/-2.5V.

baci-property.description: LO2 Module Codes

monitor-point.description: LO2 Module Codes

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_FREQ command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_FREQ command. It will return zero if the SET_FREQ command has never been called. The default output frequency upon power up of the FTS is DC or zero hertz.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_FREQ command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_FREQ command. It will return zero if the SET_FREQ command has never been called. The default output frequency upon power up of the FTS is DC or zero hertz.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_VALS command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_VALS command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_VALS command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_VALS command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_VALS command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_VALS command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the counts number of clock cycles between the previous TE and the preceding TE for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. It can be used to verify that the number of clock cycles between timing events is exactly 6 million. This monitor point should be used for debugging purposes. For operational purposes use the GET_FTS_STATUS command.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides the counts number of clock cycles between the previous TE and the preceding TE for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. It can be used to verify that the number of clock cycles between timing events is exactly 6 million. This monitor point should be used for debugging purposes. For operational purposes use the GET_FTS_STATUS command.

baci-property.description: Status of the output RF power level of the FTS. One bit will latch if a transient problem in the FTS output RF power level is detected. Status of clock cycles between timing events. One of two bits is latched high if the number of clock cycles between TE is not exactly 6000000. The number of clock cycles between TE is counted for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. All latched bits except bit 5 can be unlatched using the RESET_FTS_STATUS command. Bit 5 can be changed with the SET_CLOCK_INVERSION command.

monitor-point.description: Status of the output RF power level of the FTS. One bit will latch if a transient problem in the FTS output RF power level is detected. Status of clock cycles between timing events. One of two bits is latched high if the number of clock cycles between TE is not exactly 6000000. The number of clock cycles between TE is counted for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. All latched bits except bit 5 can be unlatched using the RESET_FTS_STATUS command. Bit 5 can be changed with the SET_CLOCK_INVERSION command.

baci-property.description: This is the read back of SET_PHASE_OFFSET. It is the amount by which the phase switching is delayed. The delay of the first phase switching value is a minimum of 8 ms and a maximum of 15.9996 ms with 8 ns of resolution. This monitor will return 8 ms if the SET_PHASE_OFFSET control point has never been called i.e., after power up.

monitor-point.description: This is the read back of SET_PHASE_OFFSET. It is the amount by which the phase switching is delayed. The delay of the first phase switching value is a minimum of 8 ms and a maximum of 15.9996 ms with 8 ns of resolution. This monitor will return 8 ms if the SET_PHASE_OFFSET control point has never been called i.e., after power up.

baci-property.description: Generic Monitor Point. Number of transactions handled by the slave node since power up.

baci-property.description: Generic Monitor Point. Revision level of the embedded code. This is the software embedded in the AMBSI or the programmable device that is handling the AMB communications.

monitor-point.description: Generic Monitor Point. Revision level of the embedded code. This is the software embedded in the AMBSI or the programmable device that is handling the AMB communications.

baci-property.description: Generic Monitor Point. Temperature measured by the DS1820 chip.
